AF5A8FC09E9E41F38ED5AB717357D7FD.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: reflect and revise without using unapproved sources or technologies to avoid plagiarism; cite and contextualize all sources used to comply with legal requirements

E92DE381E4974CC497A1A0CC220B2174.description: Revise: evaluate peer/your own work and clarify, reorganize, and make other adjustments to assignments to showcase new and improved learning

DA6FA94811D947F28B1DA90426686EEC.description: Reflect: recall and verbalize your thoughts and actions during the process of achieving your own thinking/learning and identify actionable modifications and goals that could improve your thinking and learning

A372D113A7B54155A0793104E5127E5C.description: Revisit: regularly review your learning and assignments to recognize where you are in learning, make improvements, and know where you need to go

8656D2E4C3A042719351B265E0F470E0.description: Revisit, Reflect, & Revise - I can systematically reflect on my learning by seeking and receiving feedback from teachers, peers, and self-evaluations, revising my work, and identifying areas of growth to demonstrate improved learning and thinking.

1073F46C3B874852B0FF03F2366CDDFE.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: inquire, research, analyze, evaluate, distinguish, and compare sources without using unapproved sources or technologies to avoid plagiarism; cite and contextualize all sources used to comply with legal requirements

3EEFC8888C39459FB0E1B7DA38B64BA3.description: Distinguish & Compare: compare texts' styles, messages, reasoning, and reliability to discern and differentiate fact from opinion and differing perspectives, conclusions, & motives

3F80926197414B22B063F47F9E14B83D.description: Analyze & Evaluate: closely read, question, assess, and judge a source to correctly identify its reliability, validity, information, and/or argument/conclusions

90628FCC2CF54C7797C20A0F5D65BF45.description: Synthesize & Conclude: read and interpret information in a variety of sources to connect ideas and formulate a conclusion or argument

23B7338833C0467BA3FB64CE126614C8.description: Inquire & Gather: develop research questions and expertly search, select, and organize a variety of reliable sources with information to expand your learning or solve a problem

C1610B39C28D4300A851B27D381B3A2D.description: Research & Evaluate - I can learn about a topic by selecting and evaluating sources, synthesizing information, and recognizing diverse perspectives to become a more critical consumer of information.

0EE90CBDF68E436AA1E251AC62E5E881.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: ethically credit the ideas of others through written & verbal attribution without help from unapproved sources or technologies to avoid plagiarism; cite all sources used to comply with legal requirements

BF87EA4B38394B829CBA0D0654ED87F1.description: Participation & Inclusion: incorporate all group members in the development of ideas, decision making, solving problems to reach a consensus/compromise

18B5F588C5344289B3035DE172754B43.description: Setting & Following Norms: develop rules & roles to support building a community of trust capable of facilitating diverse discussions

64C88A33601043469214D522EB7AE4D7.description: Responding & Discussing: tactfully and respectfully engage with peers in a group setting to achieve a common goal

DBE6D843B648497EA3B67B1AD3E870DD.description: Speaking & Listening: speak purposefully and sustain active listening when engaging with peers to demonstrate your commitment to the group/task

8B85C5CFF4524FB8B88375D72E0D2F41.description: Communication & Collaboration - I can consistently collaborate with others by cultivating a supportive learning community to develop new understandings and learn from my peers.

B1CC23773E90474B956B911F2B7CA405.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: plan, organize, create, and deliver ideas/presentations without help from unapproved sources or technologies to avoid plagiarism; cite all sources used to comply with legal requirements

812EF1FD25FD4CECB15D6EC04498A8A7.description: Technology & Visuals: use and blend appropriate technology to create visuals with consideration and support for your audience (font size, word & line count, images, keywords, etc.)

E5A35F3E306E49F1BBD2B5B407F4081F.description: Anticipating Audience Needs: use knowledge of the audience to predict their questions/misconceptions/needs and include preemptive measures (timing, activities, visuals, and/or explanation) to enhance learning, prevent misunderstandings, and curb boredom

6195CFD965B84039BD19B874CD857DD4.description: Non-Verbal skills: eye contact, facial expressions, body movement, gestures, appearance, physical presence

E6693DA1C96D49828B8CAE3B8780E7F2.description: Verbal skills: pace, volume, pronunciation, articulation, fluency, inflection, expression, energy

4703D4F404A44803B014393360FE5CC3.description: Verbal & Non-Verbal Delivery: utilize practiced & appropriate verbal skills and control appropriate non-verbal actions to engage the audience and create credibility,

8A94CA2B59EA4D13B22684D1E5ED5B74.description: Developing & Supporting Ideas: effectively plan, organize, and deliver information with purposeful organization and transitions to guide audiences to comprehend & make connections; include strong & appropriate vocabulary, evidence, reasoning, sources, technology, and other supplements (visuals, activities, etc.) to convey and support your idea/purpose/audience

115B45F44BE045B0BF6864A34695AE71.description: Performance & Design - I can clearly communicate ideas for an audience by using purposeful language, performance skills, and supplemental materials to achieve an intended effect or goal.

580ACC544CAE4178BCED103061A87E25.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: edit, format, and cite your work without help from unapproved sources or technologies to avoid plagiarism; cite all sources used to comply with legal requirements

1AAE275D74964B848DB541D4BE5830EA.description: Citation Method & Formatting: correctly & consistently use MLA or APA citation method or other task requirements to format your writing and document information from sources; include in-text citations, the Works Cited/References page, and all grammatical, logistical, aesthetic, and citation conventions required to comply with directions and regulations

ECEE5FC1714444EB86C89A8356A94B5E.description: Syntax: correctly and appropriately incorporate phrases/clauses, voice, and varied sentence structures to enhance writing to create style and clarity

A3AD36642A9F47C0876F28D98189FF76.description: Grammar, Usage, & Mechanics: edit for and use correct punctuation, spelling, word usage, tense and other mechanics as recognized by the conventions of Standard English to maintain clarity

565B3B5A0476488BBEA13A27131E7362.description: Technical Conventions - I can edit my writing by including & correctly using technical conventions appropriate for my genre, topic, and audience throughout a variety of writing styles, genres, & purposes to improve my clarity.

9562E462BAFF415BA766A0D3AD397CFF.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: write in your own style & voice, without using unapproved sources or technologies to avoid plagiarism; cite and contextualize all sources used to comply with legal requirements

126A0E43191F42CC926CFC2FE4166B0B.description: Stylistic Choices: make purposeful choices in literary/persuasive/rhetorical devices, vocabulary, diction, sentence structure, & grammatical choices to create intended & appropriate tone & voice to create a style that impacts the reader and supports your idea; use of academic vocabulary when necessary & appropriate

204227B524794E0883A8579B62774C4D.description: Modes, Forms, & Techniques: choose or blend appropriate writing types/genres/structures along with the corresponding, complementary language and style to communicate a specific topic, argument, & purpose

263B338E0A354A43BA0AAA420E3E198C.description: Mode & Style - I can write with appropriate voice and style by thoughtfully including & manipulating language and sentence structure throughout a variety of writing styles, genres, & purposes to match my genre, topic, and audience.

98517700950C4F499D649BB753AB8E80.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: organize an idea in writing without using unapproved sources or technologies to avoid plagiarism; cite and contextualize all sources used to comply with legal requirements

C7018B7E052041EBB20D3F762B246E55.description: Characteristics: incorporate relevant, genre-specific characteristics and formatting to aid audiences in make meaning

978EBC57D661409F9DEACD0524D6CC09.description: include transition words and phrases to showcase progression and connections between ideas

35D4EE5F35AB433DB9EAB3945E4F21A1.description: thoughtfully and logically order paragraphs, events/plotline, claims, details/evidence, and explanation/expansion to clarify the idea development for specific audiences

788E0AAAC36C4BAEA2E29FE25DAC6495.description: organize writing overall into 3 parts (idea/thesis= introduction, body, conclusion; storyline= beginning, middle, end) to introduce readers to a topic, provide them commentary, and concludes the information/explanation/idea presented

B2A5860296B64765842D740DF9283509.description: Organization & Progression: organize and structures writing to clarify the development of an idea and relationships between ideas

04AED7B0F8FB428B803654388678C2D3.description: Organization & Elements - I can thoughtfully plan, organize, and transition my idea/storyline/thesis by selecting and/or blending appropriate genre(s) along with applicable text characteristics throughout a variety of writing styles, genres, & purposes to support my audience.

11A326B447C544AA801DA1B84FF71969.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: develop and idea without using unapproved sources or technologies to avoid plagiarism; cite and contextualize all sources used to comply with legal requirements

3150C0E8AA914FA19D4C3A87669A0F23.description: Anticipate & Refute: anticipate counterarguments, and alternative perspectives and provide well-developed, supported rebuttals to strengthen your argument/idea

4B05CEC04B874AD6B928AF1D03A1F666.description: Clarify & Support: develop and support an idea by formulating a clear and thorough explanation or line of reasoning, providing strong, appropriate details/evidence for an idea/storyline/thesis, and using transition words to lead the audience to an intended conclusion and to make connections

1FCB71F5191146909A4E5F9C8ED1E8A2.description: Generate & Develop: generate an idea/storyline/thesis that is appropriate to the topic/purpose/genre of writing and is focused, high-quality, and unique to communicate careful, deep thinking and synthesis of information

03EF9B032C35471A85D300DFBB4ECBBD.description: Developing Quality Ideas - I can generate, develop, support, and clearly convey a high-quality, unique idea/storyline/thesis by producing a variety of writing styles, genres, and purposes to strengthen my critical thinking and communication.

A5393ACE8D4C46158BA61B038A67B760.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: examine, interpret, describe, identify, explain, contextualize, analyze, compare, critique, defend and evaluate without using unapproved sources or technologies; cite and contextualize all sources used to comply with legal requirements

C6AF5293B2C746A8833FEA61C3132815.description: Universal Themes: identify, analyze, compare, and evaluate reoccurring messages and ideals held by many cultures, people, time periods, etc.

B2D1D7F7EBF44E8B9B67EAAC1BFF6B4B.description: Context: identify, analyze, compare, and evaluate author's personal background and other contexts (cultural, societal, social, political, religious, literary, historical, economic, geographic, technological, author's background & viewpoint, etc.)

5EC0573AC6A24AA091CCB2359F9F7FD9.description: Media: identify, analyze, compare, and evaluate influence from, impact on, & relationship with media and the people it serves

AA7D263DAC2C4DF4AD670B17C6EF88B1.description: Social Context - I can identify, explain, analyze, compare, and evaluate the relationship and effect of surrounding context on purpose/theme/main idea by reading and citing evidence from a variety of grade-level appropriate texts to build my knowledge and see connections.

A7A190F63E904614B1F951DC91652A7C.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: examine, interpret, describe, identify, explain, contextualize, analyze, compare, critique, defend and evaluate without using unapproved sources or technologies; cite and contextualize all sources used to comply with legal requirements

5EF5290DD16F4F539DFB804C940A956F.description: Stylistic Choices: identify, analyze, compare, and evaluate word choice (tone, voice, diction, connotation), structural devices (repetition, parallelism, etc.), grammar and syntax (punctuation & sentence structure)

9D1467D090124F7E91555EDBB5D863BA.description: onomatopoeia, alliteration, assonance, cadence, dialect, etc.

F2DDA3BD501743E3ACF82F019C2402DB.description: comparative (metaphor, personification, allusion, etc.), contrasting (irony, paradox, etc.), and ambiguous (innuendo, pun, etc.)

DACD66E71526484B93A439C875CCF6C5.description: Language Devices: identify, analyze, compare, and evaluate word play, phrases, and other linguistic devices

A2B2805EE1AA4B2F884C0222284B8BC0.description: Language Devices & Style - I can identify, explain, analyze, compare, and evaluate the relationship and effect of language devices and style on purpose/theme/main idea by reading and citing evidence from a variety of grade-level appropriate texts to build my knowledge and see connections.

02C15EBEEC6D4F0DBC4FE0349C9393DB.description: Plagiarism & Ethics: examine, interpret, describe, identify, explain, contextualize, analyze, compare, critique, defend and evaluate without using unapproved sources or technologies; cite and contextualize all sources used to comply with legal requirements

6EC31C8A24D84DFF8F4DC4BEC9B21CA7.description: Character Development & Roles: identify, analyze, compare, and evaluate characterization, types, roles, development, relationships, and archetypes

87CC2F22D03742F980A77D19CCA47DF9.description: Structure & Organization: identify, analyze, compare, and evaluate text structure, plot/progression, organizational pattern, format, graphics & other supplementary materials

0B118FCDB4034810B797AB729BAD9377.description: Genre Characteristics & Purpose: identify, analyze, compare, and evaluate genre & genre-specific characteristics, point-of-view, purpose, theme, main idea

2D8500DE1B474F3BBFF73A7B996671AC.description: Text Characteristics & Structure - I can identify, explain, analyze, compare, and evaluate the relationship and effect of characteristics and organization on purpose/theme/main idea by reading and citing evidence from a variety of grade-level appropriate texts to build my knowledge and see connections.

2C4FE4E5DBC14A8FA2D4CD623EB01795.description: Examining Vocabulary: analyze roots & affixes, origins & cognates, parts of speech, context & connotation, and synonyms & antonyms to determine the meaning of unknown words

1E6648E586BA439EAB95857789BCAAF6.description: Self-Monitoring & Connecting: connect to prior knowledge, self-monitor/inquire/correct, make judgements, and question the author to personalize comprehension

EDC1A1B37B0444FA8AA20317B80A26A3.description: Anticipating and Predicting: use knowledge of text and language characteristics/structures to predict and expand meaning

ADD0B4A299C945DBB303AE2A081EF173.description: Assessing & Creating Meaning: summarize, paraphrase, visualize, inference, and draw conclusions with supporting textual evidence

773DAA774801456083B2D1DB489C5E38.description: Developing Reading Skills - I can improve my reading level, vocabulary, and knowledge by routinely reading for a variety of purposes and using strategies to choose and comprehend grade-level appropriate texts.
